availability.p: Dieses Dokument ist ggf. rechtlich geschützt. Bitte informieren Sie sich in der Rubrik Rechte des Paratextes.

div.head: 1.1.1881 Samstag
div.p:
This morning aunt Lulu and I went to church. We wanted to go to the german church but we could not find our way so we went to the French one and heard the celebrated Protestant preacher Delille preach This evening Prince Reuss Reuß j. L., Heinrich XVIII. came to diner. M r
and M rs Kynnersley came to see Mamma who had lovely bouquets today. At diner with prince Reuss the conversation turned on what the Bürgermeister Ockel did to us in Pyrmont this summer and which for various reasons I could not put into my diary then but I take this occasion of doing so: When Mamma told Ockel that we were going away in a few days he said that Papa had said he was going to stay 5 weeks, Mamma of course said it was not true so he said he would have Mamma taken up; Mamma got into a dreadful fright because Baby Brion, Wilma was very nearly dying she wrote to Papa to come derectly. Papa arrived with a recommendation letter from the german embassy Ockel said, to use his expression „He fichoid himself of the german embassy“Vermutlich von "se ficher de quelqu'un", ugs. "auf jemanden pfeifen". Mamma threatened with the emperor Wilhelm I. „I fichai myself of him“ said he; Papa told him to take his oath Papa had said he was going to live there 5 weeks „and if I have not said it“ said he and he shewed Papa an order not signed by anybody but himself that whosoever lives in his houses must live there five weeks. so Papa went to Mister v. L....... the Badekommissär who sent him to M r Möckel the lawyier who said he would take the matter in hands. The Bürgermeister wrote an impertinent letter to Papa which Papa gave to M r Möckel. But Baby being so ill Papa did not like going on with the law suit and so he paid Ockel 50 Marks and Möckel 30 Marks, hardly had he done this when Mr v. L....... comes in „à toute vitesse“ saying he hopes Papa has not given it up because the countess Feil had been played the same trick upon by Ockel Papa said he had payed so the countess Feil had (I suppose) to pay too The day before we left Pyrmont we drove to Hameln and when we came back the people were very quiteZwei durch große X gekennzeichnete Stellen markieren eine Umstellung. Die Transkription folgt der Umstellung. Der Name des Badekommissärs ist von Kessler nicht ausgeschrieben.
